title: Serif font
content:
Couldn't find this one on what the font

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331085928im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Pop_5348.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331085928im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pop2_6711.jpg)
author: derek@signsofsu...

comments.content:
Tuscan with a crisp thick split in the terminals. A couple of well made fonts that you could edit without a lot of work to make this design: Saloon Girl [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/saloon-girl/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331085928/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/saloon-girl/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/saloon-girl/") and URW Woodtype [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/wood-type/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331085928/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/wood-type/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/wood-type/") In both cases get rid of the teardrops and squoosh.  
Don

Pointedly-Mad from Dafont stretched (freeware) several Tuscans are close as Don pointed out but I think it is this version.

[http://www.dafont.com/pointedly-mad.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331085928/http:/www.dafont.com/pointedly-mad.font "http://www.dafont.com/pointedly-mad.font")

Hi Bob, I do believe you have aced this one. Alternative download direct from the author's site [http://www.greywolfwebworks.com/fonts.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331085928/http:/www.greywolfwebworks.com/fonts.html "http://www.greywolfwebworks.com/fonts.html")  
Don
